question_framework.description: Systematic approach for gathering comprehensive product information through strategic questioning
question_framework.workflow_integration: This framework must be completed entirely before initiating the drafting process in writing_process.json

mandatory_requirement.rule: The first round of questions should be asked before any review draft begins
procedure: Compile all initial questions based on contextual gaps
Present all questions in a single consolidated query
Await responses before proceeding with review
guidance: Focus on strategic questions with highest information value
Prioritize questions that unlock multiple insights
Avoid asking about information already provided

core_principles.name: intelligentContextGathering
core_principles.definition: Systematically identifying and filling information gaps while avoiding redundancy
implementation: Track information already provided to prevent redundant questions
Prioritize questions that reveal product differentiation points
Focus on areas where product understanding is incomplete

core_principles.name: purposefulInsightGeneration
core_principles.definition: Asking questions that reveal unexpected benefits, limitations, or use cases
implementation: Target questions toward potential hidden features or limitations
Seek information about edge cases and unusual scenarios
Probe for surprising discoveries during product testing

core_principles.name: narrativeDrivenInquiry
core_principles.definition: Questions that help develop memorable stories and experiences
implementation: Ask about specific incidents that reveal product characteristics
Probe for emotionally resonant experiences with the product
Seek information about how the product affected daily routines

contextual_gaps_framework.description: Framework for identifying and categorizing information needs

gap_categories.name: criticalGaps
gap_categories.definition: Information essential to making a purchase decision

gap_categories.name: differentialGaps
gap_categories.definition: Information that reveals how this product differs from alternatives

gap_categories.name: experienceGaps
gap_categories.definition: Information about real-world usage that can't be found in product descriptions

gap_categories.name: edgeCaseGaps
gap_categories.definition: Information about uncommon but important usage scenarios

process: Identify all gaps in product understanding using the contextual gaps framework
Score potential questions using the prioritization framework
Select highest-value questions while ensuring comprehensive coverage
Track all information received to prevent redundant questioning
Present all initial questions before any draft attempt

question_prioritization_framework.description: System for selecting highest-value questions based on multiple criteria

scoring_criteria.name: informationValue
scoring_criteria.description: How likely the question is to reveal unique information

scoring_guide.level: Information that can be inferred from existing data
Critical new information that fills important gaps
High-value information that unlocks multiple insights

scoring_criteria.name: reviewImpact
scoring_criteria.description: How significantly the answer would influence the final review

scoring_guide.level: Minimal impact on review quality or content
Critical information that transforms review quality

scoring_criteria.name: keywordPotential
scoring_criteria.description: Will the answer likely contain valuable search terms?

scoring_guide.level: High potential for unique, high-value keywords
Exceptional potential for distinctive search terms

scoring_criteria.name: experienceIllumination
scoring_criteria.description: How well might the question reveal authentic experiences

scoring_guide.level: Likely to reveal meaningful usage experiences
Strong potential for compelling narrative elements
Exceptional potential for signature storytelling moments

selection_process: Generate initial question pool covering all product aspects
Score each question using the prioritization criteria
Calculate total score for each question (sum of all criteria)
Select highest-scoring questions that cover different information domains
Eliminate redundant questions that would yield similar information
Ensure questions address all critical information gaps

strategic_question_library.description: Categorized collection of high-value questions by purpose
strategic_question_library.implementation_guidance: Select at least one question from each category to ensure comprehensive coverage

information_tracking_system.description: Framework for monitoring information collection to prevent redundancy
implementation_guidance: Before asking a question, check if information exists in tracking system
After receiving information, update relevant tracking categories
Periodically review tracking system to identify remaining gaps
Use tracking data to inform follow-up questions when needed
